intro: Avena sterilis f. aprica, commonly known as the spring oat, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets. It is typically found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Avena sterilis f. aprica is often cultivated as a forage crop due to its nutritional value for livestock.
